Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Titillate \Tit"il*late\, v. t. & i. [imp. & p. p. {Titillated}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Titillating}.] [L. titillatus, p. p. of titillare.] To tickle; as, to titillate the nose with a feather. [1913 Webster]
The pungent grains of titillating dust. --Pope. [1913 Webster]

titillating adj 1: pleasantly and superficially exciting 2: giving sexual pleasure; sexually arousing [syn: {erotic}] 3: exciting by touching lightly so as to cause laughter or twitching movements [syn: {tickling}, {tingling}]
